module.title: Introduction
module.contents: What is Physics? What is a scientific theory? Units of measurement; Scientific Notation; Converting Units; Measurement; Significant Figures

module.title: Motivation
module.description: Nothing is so dangerous to the progress of the human mind than to assume that our views of science are ultimate, that there are no mysteries in nature, that our triumphs are complete and that there are no new worlds to conquer.Humphrey Davy
module.contents: Particle Physics. 4 Fundamental Forces: Gravitation, Electromagnetism, Strong Interaction, Weak Interaction. Chronology of the universe

module.title: Kinematics
module.contents: Historical matter, Position, Velocity, Acceleration, Units, Reference Frames, Graphing Motion, Converting Units, Vectors

module.title: Dynamics
module.contents: Forces, Mass and Inertia, Aristotle, Galileo, Newton, Newton's Laws of Motion, Net Force, Motion and Force in Two Dimensions, Friction, Gravity, Orbits

module.title: Work and Energy
module.contents: Work Kinetic Energy; Potential Energy; The Law of Conservation of Energy; Power

module.title: Momentum
module.contents: Linear Momentum; The Law of Conservation of Momentum; Angular Momentum

module.title: Circular Motion
module.contents: Uniform Circular Motion; Centripetal Acceleration and Centripetal Force; Applications of Circular Motion

module.title: Gravity
module.contents: Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation; Gravity Near the Earth's Surface; Satellites and Weightlessness, Circular Orbits; Geosynchronous Orbits; Theories of Planetary Orbits

module.title: Fluids
module.contents: Pressure, Units for Pressure, Blaise Pascal, Fluid Pressure, Atmospheric Pressure, Transmitting Pressure in Fluids, Buoyancy, Floating and Sinking, Bernoulli's Principle

module.title: Machines
module.contents: Archimedes, Levers, Types of Levers, Mechanical Advantage, Inclines, Wheel and Axle, Pulleys, Gears, Work and Efficiency

module.title: Temperature and Heat I
module.contents: Celsius, Fahrenheit, Kelvin, Heat, Heat Capacity, Thermal Expansion, Heat Transfer, Convection, Conduction, Radiation, Light Waves, Change of Phase, Evaporation, Condensation

module.title: Temperature and Heat II
module.contents: Atoms; Temperature; Pressure; Thermal Expansion; The Gas Laws; Absolute Zero; The Mechanical Equivalent of Heat; Specific Heat; Entropy

module.title: Waves
module.contents: Oscillations; Resonance; Interference, Standing Waves; The Equation for Wave Motion; Sound Waves; The Doppler Effect; Shock Waves and the Sonic Boom; The Doppler Effect with Light Waves; Reflection; Refraction, Snell's Law; Lenses

module.title: Optics
module.contents: Reflection; Refraction, Snell's Law; Lenses

module.title: Electricity and Magnetism
module.contents: Electric Charge, Electric Current, Voltage, Direct Current and Alternating Current, Ohm`s Law, Series and Parallel Circuits, Magnets, Oersted`s Experiment, Magnetic Domains, Magnetic Fields, The Motor Effect, The Generator Effect

module.title: Electricity II
module.contents: Static Electricity; Conductors and Insulators; Lightning; Coulomb's Law; The Electric Field, Michael Faraday; Electric Field Lines; Electric Potential and Potential Difference; Simple Circuits; Capacitors

module.title: Electric Circuits
module.contents: The Electric Battery; Electric Current; Ohm's Law; Electrical Resistance; Electric Power; Alternating Current; Series and Parallel Circuits; Magnetism; Electric Motors; Power Generation

module.title: Atoms
module.contents: The Elements, The Periodic Table, Isotopes, The Nature of Light, Historical theories on light, The Quantum Hypotheses, Radioactivity, Rutherford`s Experiments, Nuclear Fission, Nuclear Fusion, The Manhatten Project

module.title: Atomic Bonds and Chemical Reactions
module.contents: Physical and Chemical Changes, Chemical Equations, Balancing simple chemical equations, Covalent Bonds, Ionic Bonds, Organic Compounds, Polymers

module.title: The Earth Moon and Sun
module.contents: Early Astronomy, The Earth-Moon-Sun System, Rotation and Revolution, Solstices and Equinoxes, Phases of the moon, Tides, Structure of the Moon, The Apollo Missions
